Franklington Henry County Ky. Aug. 11th 1863.
To his Excellency Jas F. Roberson. Gov. of Ky. and Gen. Finnell A. G.

The undersigned would most respectfully represent to you -- that Michael Rayzor a private in the 13th Ky. Vol. now stationed at Glasgo Ky. has been permitted by you to assist in raising a company in a new Regiment, which Reg. has failed to organise -- said appointment was that of Lieutenant -- we understand that the officers of his Regiment are willing to let him off by your consent -- The only question we presume is, as to his ability prudence and firmness. We beg leave to state to you a few facts in relation to this young man -- We have known M. Rayzor from his youth up. he ^was^ raised an honest hardworking boy of ordinary education. stout. hearty and robust At. the commencement of the Rebellion he took a decided stand for the Union, fell into the ranks of the first company of Home Guards raised in his neighbourhood -- was always propt and resolute -- He has been in his present Regiment about two years -- He is a soldier every inch of him and as brave as -- He is a man that may be relied upon with the utmost confidence -- and only desires an opportunity to show what what he can do for his country -- We hope therefore you will permit him to make an effort --.

H Roberts
